description.item: The full 1:40 minute interview of two renowned Chicago judges, the Honorable Judges R. Eugene Pincham (a one-time mayoral candidate) and Earl E. Strayhorn. They describe their experiences in practice, thoughts on capital punishment, the Scottsboro Case, legal education and an assortment of other issues relating to the history of law in Chicago.

item.label: Judges Pincham and Strayorn’s experience with and views on capital punishment
Judges Pincham and Strayhorn’s experience with changes in criminal practice
Judges Pincham and Strayhorn’s experience with and views on judicial elections
Judges Pincham and Strayhorn’s experience in practice
Judges Pincham and Strayhorn’s views on judicial corruption
Judges Pincham and Strayorn’s experience with and views on legal education
Judges Pincham and Strayorn’s experiences at the Northwestern School of Law
Judges Pincham and Strayorn on the Scottsboro Case

item.title: Prof. Leigh Bienen interviews Judges R. Eugene Pincham and Earl Strayhorn
